book.title: The Spirit Level: Why More Equal Societies Almost Always Do Better

review.body: Parts 1 and 2: very good, interesting and well argued. Part 3? Not so much. A bit of an awkward exercise to extrapolate their prior findings to explain global warming - unecessary.
More of a 3.5/3.75. The art is awesome and the humor is on point. I'll probably check out more of Julia's books.
Surprisingly topical and smart...even if I don't always agree.

book.title: The Case of the Incapacitated Capitals

review.body: Colorful illustrations, combined with a decent story and all the capitals in bold and different colors work well to introduce younger readers to the importance and proper usage of capital letters. It's the kind of book that lends itself to repeat reading in order to help kids understand and then...

book.title: Teaching from Rest: A Homeschooler's Guide to Unshakable Peace

review.body: I read the updated version. One of the better homeschooling books I have read. Great things to ponder in here on what homeschooling should really be about.
